intro: Coccoloba orinocana, commonly known as the Orinoco beauty, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, acidic soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
